pros:
It's a medical system that includes several clinics, a psychiatric hospital, a rehab hospital, and 3 acute care hospitals including a busy inner city trauma center with a mission to serve all without regard to pay. 

Excellent pension.
 
Management has trimmed away much of the "dead wood" and is placing Highland Hospital (the trauma center) on a path towards Magnet status.

A chance to work and teach residents as they progress through their residency.
cons:
The electronic medical record by Siemens - Soarian is horrible.

Not a good place for non-empathetic people.

pros: Great mission and vision for the organization and a deep desire within the company to do the right thing in delivering  care to all patients regardless of the ability to pay.
cons: Basic operational functions do not work well and their is a desire by some employees and leaders to keep the organization in the dark ages so they can complain about how hard the work is rather than make things better.

pros: co-workers, lax dress policy, ability to rearrange assignments sometimes.
cons: Rough area, you have to pay $10 a day to park or try to find parking on the street which is next to impossible and if you do your car will get broken into or stolen. Very dirty hospital, EVS does not do their job. Constantly out of supplies such as blood tubes or even food and utensils. Not a safe place to work, there are many aggressive and violent patients. Staff members are constantly being cussed at, threatened, and assaulted by patients. No recognition for hard work. Management plays favorites and does not help defend it's employees from violations against the MOU or having scheduling privledges taken away. Sadly used to be a decent place to work but is no long that way. Over worked and underpaid and understaffed.

pros: Great benefits, the new acute care tower is beautiful
cons: Outdated Technology hinders AHS' ability to provide the best quality they can deliver.  Alot of double talk from the management team. They like to dangle carrots and say they'll do things and do not deliver.  For example, I asked to have my job description job drawn up and was constantly told it was being worked on after 6+ months of having worked there. Be cautious when accepting a job offer, get everything in writing first and don't sign anything agreeing to be unrepresented by the Union; they'll overwork you without adequate compensation. Career advancement in certain departments are limited.

job_title: Youth Development Coordinator in Emeryville, CA
pros: AJS is a community institution whose primary purpose to care for, teach, heal and to serve all who are in need of access to health care services, regardless of their ability to pay.
cons: With such a vast mission, AHS still has its work ahead with trying to truly serve all. Yet the vastness of this task is out  of their control, there is still a large patient population who still need to actively access AHS's services.

review_title: Good people on a mission to drive change
pros: Alameda Health System is a pillar of the community leading the journey to wellness. Although the health system has been established for more than 150 years there is so much opportunity to establish new processes to drive efficiencies.  A true place for someone with an entrepreneurial spirit looking to build and impact the community at the same time.
cons: Can become overwhelming when being pulled in different directions but at the same time that is what makes it such an exciting place to be.

pros: Staff are dedicated, warm, and welcoming. Your employees are often truly a pleasure to work with.
cons: Leadership has no coherent and central guiding vision. The aspirational Mission and Vison statements translate into little in the way of meaningful action. Leadership makes truly terrible (not to mention often capricious) decisions with little planning or forethought. The organization is unnecessarily very oppositionally oriented with their labor represented staff. Leadership hiring decisions are excessively arbitrary and make little functional sense.

pros: The company's rank and file employees are fully committed to the community they serve.  They go above and beyond to provide excellent care.
cons: Rank and file employees are not given the tools they need to succeed and are more often than not under managers who do not know how to manage or deal with changing circumstances.

pros: Electronic Lift Devices in all patients rooms, wonderful coworkers, beautiful setting that is close to terrific shopping areas including a great public library and bird store, knowledgeable, approachable physicians, intensiveists, great respiratory therapy department, good Pt/Ot departments, good shuttle service between hospitals and rapid transit systems,strong union presence.
cons: Non user friendly computer system; inflexible, not present nurse manager; parking is a nightmare for pm shift; cafeteria closes early on weekends; limited and geographically inconvenient pharmacy; poor nursing education.

pros: Work life balance is good, flexible options like working from home
cons: As a new employee, I feel little motivation from my coworkers to work hard or improve things because it feels that there are deep problems at every turn and few people who care to do anything about them. Not a place for ambitious young people who want to make real change.

pros: Alameda Health Systems is a huge company and there is so much room to grow and learn. The company has some of the best benefits that I have ever seen a company offers and so many Unions. They really do care for their employees.
cons: I have not encountered any cons yet to working for this company.

pros: The mission is what brings me to work every day: serving everyone in our community. Staff from the front lines to the senior executives are committed to patients and families.
cons: There are so many things happening at AHS that communication amongst staff and departments sometimes takes a back seat.

pros: Good patients, very culturally diverse, you will learn a lot. The people I worked directly with, managers and coworkers were great, unlike upper management.
cons: You risk being laid off, poor fiscal management. I was laid off only a year after a recruiter told me this was a great opportunity. Dealing with the union fighting with the employer was highly stressful.

review_title: Amazing mission in a difficult environment
